headline: Homemade Chili
description: This chili recipe with kidney beans, chili powder, garlic, and green chile peppers is always a winner!
name: Homemade Chili
recipeIngredient: 2 cloves garlic, minced, or more to taste
2 (16 ounce) cans kidney beans, rinsed and drained
1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add onion and garlic; cook and stir until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Add ground beef; cook and stir until browned, 8 to 10 minutes.
Transfer beef mixture to a 6-quart slow cooker. Stir in kidney beans, diced tomatoes, tomato puree, water, green chile peppers, chili powder, salt, cumin, and black pepper.
Cook on Low until flavors combine, 4 to 6 hours.

review.reviewBody: I followed the spirit of the recipe, if not every detail. The main differences are that 1) I used dry pinto beans that I had soaked and cooked separately as noted in the Tips, and 2) instead of a slow cooker I slow simmered the mixture in a large pot for 4 hours, stirring occasionally. I also garnished with cilantro, diced onion, and grated cheese. It was a hit with my very discerning critic (wife).
Quick, easy, delicious. The slow cooker brings all the flavors together. This was a snap to make!

Good starting recipe, added scallions, a single stalk of celery, upped the chilli powder to 3 tbsp, subbed one lb ground pork for 1 lb ground beef, and cooked in crock pot for 5 hours, absolutely delicious!!!
It was ok.

To the person who suggested beans don‚Äôt go in chili, she needs to try more versions of chili. There isn‚Äôt 1 approved chili recipe but this one, with beans!, is a good one. Make it. With beans. Ignore complainers. They apparently don‚Äôt like variety.
I like chili soup, so instead of the pur√©e tomatoes and cup of water I use 32 ounces of beef broth.
we love this recipe and have been making it for many years. The only thing I do differently is I add a cup of picante sauce instead of green chilis othe wise exactly the same.
Can‚Äôt wait to make it, this sounds like the best I‚Äôve ever seen as a recipe üòá

This is close to the way I use to make it. With small changes it is greatly improved. The difference is in the details: Addition of a small amount of sausage (1/3 of beef amt.) or brats. Remove the ground Brat ingredients from the casing and brown with the beef. Add the garlic & onions until cooked. I can't tolerate chile pepper so I use Louisiana Hot Sauce, and Worcester sauce to enrich the beef flavor, salt to taste. Add the beans, diced canned tomatoes, beef consomm√© instead of water. 1 can each of the last three ingredients. My hubs likes a small amount of pasta in chili. I was told that it is an Indiana "thing".
I made it, and I didn‚Äôt change anything, loved it!
Great chili ‚Ä¶ I loved it with beans! Used red kidney beans.
I love chili but I do NOT use any beans in mine. If I want beans for meal, then I will have beans and cornbread

Another tasty addition is a can of pumpkin pur√©e. It adds a thick richness. If desired even a tsp of sugar will not come amiss. Oooo! And a big tablespoon of sour cream on top after you dish it up. (Just some personal additions. ;-D. )

Trust the reviews! Of course there are limitless varieties of chili....green, red, beans, no beans, Texas style...and on and on. But...one big change, and this is my gold standard. Instead of two cans of chili beans...One chili bean, and one dark red kidney beans....and there you go. Now go find a great cornbread recipe, a beer, sit back and enjoy.

This is exactly the same recipe I‚Äôve been using for years, and it is perfect. Sometimes I add some ground chorizo or other sausage for a little bit more flavor, but otherwise it is the same recipe. Don‚Äôt skimp on the cumin. It gives the chili a nice ‚Äúafterburn‚Äù. Compliments, Healthy Girl!
First, skip the beans and it‚Äôs pretty good chili.
It's get for a cold night.
I used 1/2 cup of chili powder for more intense flavor--Terrific!
You can also make this with ground chicken or turkey. Dont tell anyone. With all of the spices they will never guess its not beef.
superb!
This was a good standard, no-nonsense chili. So perfect for a weeknight.

This recipe is super easy, and the chili is delicious. I don‚Äôt like a lot of beans, so I only used one can. I also upped the spice a bit by adding 1/8 tsp cayenne and 1 extra tsp each of chili powder and cumin. Even my husband loved it, and he‚Äôs not a big chili lover. This will not disappoint!
I made this recipe, but instead of ground beef and sausage; used spinach. Yes, this spinach lasagna was üî•üî•üî•üî•üî• Truly a hit. Thank you.
It gets better as you re-heat and serve. But was great right out of the gate.
One of the best chili recipes. My wife and I loved it!!!

I like dishes that are quick and easy to prepare as well as delicious to eat. This recipe hits all the marks! The real test is my kids. All of them go back for seconds so it definitely a winner. I cook on the stove top to save time. Add cheddar cheese, corn chips, and sour cream and chow down!
Very good. Easy.

This turned out so delicious, and I am not an expert cook. I used ground chicken instead of beef, and veggie broth instead of water. I also added one extra tsp each of cumin and chili. And added some granulated garlic and onion flakes (1 tsp each) in addition to what was listed in recipe because I like mine spicy. Yum!!!!
The recipe was easy. But because I can't have ground beef. I used ground turkey and it turn out very good.

Very simple recipe, very good. I made the following substitutions and it was just fine: I used 2 cubes frozen sauteed onion (found at target), 2 cubes frozen garlic cubes (found at target), Bush's chili beans, crushed tomato instead of diced, tomato sauce instead of puree, chopped jalapeno rather than green chili peppers.

Finally found a chili recipe I like so thanks for posting this. Did not change a thing. Used 93/7 ground meat so I didn't need to stare into a bowl of grease. The proportion of tomatoes & puree to spices was spot on - tasted the way chili should - not overly tomato-y. Was even tastier the next day.

This was great!! I only made a few changes, but the family loved it!! I used 1 lb. of ground beef and 1 lb. of ground Italian sausage, which really added some amazing flavor. Instead of 2 cans of kidney beans, I used a can of cannelloni beans, a can of Bush‚Äôs Chili Pinto Beans, a can of Rotel (instead of the can of chilis), and tomato paste instead of the sauce. I also added a small can of mushrooms (because I‚Äôm crazy like that), and threw in a cup of frozen sweet corn towards the end. Served it with sour cream and hot sauce. The fam said to remember exactly how I made it!

I cooked this in My Instant Pot for 1 hour. It was wonderful. If you choose this method, make sure you deglaze the bottom of the pan after you cook the meat mixture with additional water to avoid a burn notification. It was even better the next day.
This was a great recipe. There is something missing though, but I‚Äôm not sure what. We will definitely make it again though!

Used 3 lbs extra lean ground beef, two cans green chilies, two cans tomato paste, doubled the garlic, cumin, and chilli powder, added one fresh chopped green pepper, and 5 bay leaves. I did not add water. With two hours left to slow cook I added a can of niblets corn and 3/4 cup of dry red wine. This was made one day prior to serving it so the flavours had time to meld. Served with sharp cheddar, sour cream and dehydrated hot chilli pepper if desired. WOW - Fantastic!!
Great simple chill. Used ground turkey instead
Easy, and taste fantastic. I only added one thing 1.5 teaspoons of Cayenne pepper to kick it up a notch
Really good and easy! I added sour cream and cheddar cheese to the serving bowl and it was delicious!

This chili was a hit at our church potluck! We used 1 pound ground beef and 1 pound sausage. We also used 1 can of cannellini beans and 1 can of pinto beans. We also had Fritos, shredded cheddar cheese, diced red onions, and sour cream to add to your chili if you wanted. We will be making this again!
Love it!!This is now my go to chili recipe. I‚Äôve tried many and this is by far my favorite. Very easy too. I added an extra can of beans.
I used ground turkey and added a little more cumin. It was delicious. Everyone gobbled it up. I am going to experiment with other beans while using this as a base recipe.
Very good! Thank you for sharing!!
I added tomato paste instead of puree and added 2 cups rather that 1 one of water. Kids lived it so it's a winner.
This recipe turned out very delicious. Initially, I didn't know what the spice kumin does for the taste, but now I know it is one of the key elements to the spicy food.
This recipe turned out very delicious. Initially, I didn't know what the spice kumin does for the taste, but now I know it is one of the key elements to the spicy food.
Made recipe as is and was well received. It was not too spicy, so those who liked more heat added hot sauce.
I made this for a chili competition and everyone voted it for first place..... man it it delicious
Easy to make and vert hearty. Family loved it.
Easy and yummy.
Easy and everyone loves it!
Easy to make & delicious my kids loved it and asked for seconds!
I cut recipe in half for smaller group. Was easy and extremely good.
Used Top Sirloin Steak and made macoroni for a quick Chili Mac.

I used shallots instead of onions. Also added a few tbsps of Tabasco, and white beans, in addition to the red beans. Served it with Mexican blended shredded cheese, cast iron skillet cornbread and Sierra Nevada Torpedo IPAs. Great Sunday evening meal!

This was AMAZING! cooked on low for 4.5 hours in a 5 quart crockpot. Added a little extra cumin and chili powder. Had 2.3 lbs of ground beef. Also used one can kidney beans and 1 can cannelini beans. The combo was very good. Will make this often!
Good chili recipe. I only had a pound of beef so I halved the spices. I also didn‚Äôt add beans to my chili.
Good, basic chili. Exactly what I wanted.

Well it was my first batch of chili, that I've made in a really long time. I did substitute a few items,I used turkey and hot Italian sausage and peppered thick sliced bacon. I like my chili hot so I added habanero peppers and serrano peppers and black beans with red peppers and onions. This was a great recipe and it was relatively easy and I'm not very good in the kitchen. And not to mention easy clean up to boot.

I was looking for a healthy chili and came across this one. I used extra lean beef, mixed beans instead of just kidney, I added an extra tbsp of chill powder and tsp of cayenne to spice it up a bit. It's a great slow cook meal that tastes better the longer it goes. Loved it the next day too! Thanks Healthy Girl, we'll make this one again.

Homemade Chili Haiku: "Not sure it's 'homemade' when ingredients are canned. But dang, is it good!" I halved the recipe for 2 adults and 2 kiddos, using a can of Rotel and one 15 oz. can of tomato sauce instead of the puree and made it in advance, letting it simmer in the dutch oven for an afternoon, tucking it into the fridge, then re-simmering next day b4 serving with cheese and Frito scoops. Nothing outstanding about this chili but maybe that's why we ate all of it up with no complaints. It's just a good, easy, basic chili. Can't wait for cooler Fall temperatures so we can have it again.
